cards.flavor: "Give me a bit of steel and I'll deliver it into the hearts of my enemies."
cards.name: Auriok Glaivemaster
cards.text: As long as Auriok Glaivemaster is equipped, it gets +1/+1 and has first strike.

cards.flavor: A single light unleashes a hail of cleansing.
cards.name: Echoing Calm
cards.text: Destroy target enchantment and all other enchantments with the same name as that enchantment.

cards.name: Emissary of Hope
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Emissary of Hope deals combat damage to a player, you gain 1 life for each artifact that player controls.

cards.flavor: "Bend with the storm, then reply in kind."
cards.name: Hallow
cards.text: Prevent all damage target spell would deal this turn. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.

cards.flavor: The strongest of the pride are measured not by the steel in their hands but by the steel in their souls.
cards.name: Leonin Battlemage
cards.text:
{T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Whenever you cast a spell, you may untap Leonin Battlemage.

cards.flavor: Her instinct is as sharp as her blade.
cards.name: Leonin Shikari
cards.text: You may activate equip abilities any time you could cast an instant.

cards.flavor: As the nim storm across the plains, a lone priest stands in their path. At his silent gesture, the battle line breaks, and the tide turns.
cards.name: Loxodon Mystic
cards.text: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.

cards.flavor: The Auriok have fought the metal hordes for so long now that knowing how to cripple them has become an instinct.
cards.name: Metal Fatigue
cards.text: Tap all artifacts.

cards.name: Pristine Angel
cards.text:
Flying
As long as Pristine Angel is untapped, it has protection from artifacts and from all colors.
Whenever you cast a spell, you may untap Pristine Angel.

cards.flavor: Defending to the death isn't always enough.
cards.name: Pteron Ghost
cards.text:
Flying
Sacrifice Pteron Ghost: Regenerate target artifact.

cards.flavor: Before religion or civilization, there was order.
cards.name: Pulse of the Fields
cards.text: You gain 4 life. Then if an opponent has more life than you, return Pulse of the Fields to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: For the first and last time, the horrific creature experienced terror.
cards.name: Purge
cards.text: Destroy target artifact creature or black creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.flavor: Leonin raising ceremonies take place at the white sun's dawn, the rebirth of artifacts mirroring the birth of a new day.
cards.name: Ritual of Restoration
cards.text: Return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor:
"I have seen the end of times, a future in which all our kind are torn from this world."
—Ushanti, leonin shaman
cards.name: Soulscour
cards.text: Destroy all nonartifact permanents.

cards.flavor: Theirs is a craft brought about by necessity, now raised to the level of art.
cards.name: Steelshaper Apprentice
cards.text: {W}, {T}, Return Steelshaper Apprentice to its owner's hand: Search your library for an Equipment card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Stir the Pride
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn.
• Until end of turn, creatures you control gain "Whenever this creature deals damage, you gain that much life."
Entwine {1}{W} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

cards.flavor: Those who survive the test bear a mark of power anyone can recognize.
cards.name: Test of Faith
cards.text: Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn. For each 1 damage prevented this way, put a +1/+1 counter on that creature.

cards.flavor: "Your arrogance is my best weapon."
cards.name: Turn the Tables
cards.text: All combat damage that would be dealt to you this turn is dealt to target attacking creature instead.

cards.flavor: Stealing goblin weapons would be easier if the goblins were smart enough to let go.
cards.name: Carry Away
cards.text:
Enchant Equipment
When Carry Away enters the battlefield, unattach enchanted Equipment.
You control enchanted Equipment.

cards.name: Chromescale Drake
cards.text:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
Flying
When Chromescale Drake enters the battlefield, reveal the top three cards of your library. Put all artifact cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.

cards.flavor: A single lie unleashes a tide of disbelief.
cards.name: Echoing Truth
cards.text: Return target nonland permanent and all other permanents with the same name as that permanent to their owners' hands.

cards.flavor: It could be made to run silently, but its low hum reminds the Neurok that they are always watched.
cards.name: Hoverguard Observer
cards.text:
Flying
Hoverguard Observer can block only creatures with flying.

cards.flavor: "Someday, someone will best me. But it won't be today, and it won't be you."
cards.name: Last Word
cards.text:
Last Word can't be countered by spells or abilities.
Counter target spell.

cards.flavor: As long as there are questions to be asked, the vedalken will ask them.
cards.name: Machinate
cards.text: Look at the top X cards of your library, where X is the number of artifacts you control. Put one of those cards into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.flavor: After the researcher's astonishing success, his assistants spent six hours finding a way to return the specimens safely to the ground.
cards.name: Magnetic Flux
cards.text: Artifact creatures you control gain flying until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "Why should I be bound by rules when I can see so far beyond them?"
cards.name: Neurok Prodigy
cards.text:
Flying
Discard an artifact card: Return Neurok Prodigy to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Neurok Transmuter
cards.text:
{U}: Target creature becomes an artifact in addition to its other types until end of turn.
{U}: Until end of turn, target artifact creature becomes blue and isn't an artifact.

cards.name: Psychic Overload
cards.text:
Enchant permanent
When Psychic Overload enters the battlefield, tap enchanted permanent.
Enchanted permanent doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
Enchanted permanent has "Discard two artifact cards: Untap this permanent."

cards.flavor: Before labs or lectures, there was insight.
cards.name: Pulse of the Grid
cards.text: Draw two cards, then discard a card. Then if an opponent has more cards in hand than you, return Pulse of the Grid to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Quicksilver Behemoth
cards.text:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
When Quicksilver Behemoth attacks or blocks, return it to its owner's hand at end of combat. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)

cards.flavor:
"Today's paperweight, tomorrow's leveler."
—Bruenna, Neurok leader
cards.name: Reshape
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Reshape, sacrifice an artifact.
Search your library for an artifact card with converted mana cost X or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor:
"Secrets are meant to remain secret."
—Memnarch
cards.name: Retract
cards.text: Return all artifacts you control to their owner's hand.

cards.name: Second Sight
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Look at the top five cards of target opponent's library, then put them back in any order.
• Look at the top five cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
Entwine {U} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

cards.flavor: Memnarch shared a touch of his power with the vedalken in return for their service. It is a debt he intends to collect.
cards.name: Synod Artificer
cards.text:
{X}, {T}: Tap X target noncreature artifacts.
{X}, {T}: Untap X target noncreature artifacts.

cards.flavor: Art is unknown to the vedalken—for them, all creations must serve a purpose.
cards.name: Vedalken Engineer
cards.text: {T}: Add two mana of any one color to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast artifact spells or activate abilities of artifacts.

cards.flavor:
"The druids would be better off if they spent more time in the lab and less time watching trees grow."
—Pontifex, elder researcher
cards.name: Vex
cards.text: Counter target spell. That spell's controller may draw a card.

cards.flavor:
"May you wake to find you were only ever a dream."
—Mephidross curse
cards.name: Æther Snap
cards.text: Remove all counters from all permanents and exile all tokens.

cards.flavor:
"The one who dies with the most toys is still dead."
—Geth, keeper of the Vault
cards.name: Burden of Greed
cards.text: Target player loses 1 life for each tapped artifact he or she controls.

cards.flavor: Bottom feeders sometimes rise to the top.
cards.name: Chittering Rats
cards.text: When Chittering Rats enters the battlefield, target opponent puts a card from his or her hand on top of his or her library.

cards.flavor: The swarm's million wings stir the foulest of breezes.
cards.name: Death Cloud
cards.text: Each player loses X life, discards X cards, sacrifices X creatures, then sacrifices X lands.

cards.flavor: A single fear unleashes a torrent of nightmares.
cards.name: Echoing Decay
cards.text: Target creature and all other creatures with the same name as that creature get -2/-2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Emissary of Despair
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Emissary of Despair deals combat damage to a player, that player loses 1 life for each artifact he or she controls.

cards.flavor: Mephidross claims all life within it. What cannot be twisted is absorbed.
cards.name: Essence Drain
cards.text: Essence Drain deals 3 damage to target creature or player and you gain 3 life.

cards.name: Greater Harvester
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a permanent.
Whenever Greater Harvester deals combat damage to a player, that player sacrifices two permanents.

cards.flavor: Even on a world of metal, there are those who thirst for blood.
cards.name: Grimclaw Bats
cards.text:
Flying
{B}, Pay 1 life: Grimclaw Bats gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Their pain is so great, they can't help but share it with others.
cards.name: Hunger of the Nim
cards.text: Target creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each artifact you control.

cards.flavor: In Mephidross, refuse doesn't last long—it's all scavenged, reanimated, or consumed.
cards.name: Mephitic Ooze
cards.text:
Mephitic Ooze gets +1/+0 for each artifact you control.
Whenever Mephitic Ooze deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature. The creature can't be regenerated.

cards.flavor: Scavengers are always the first to pay their respects.
cards.name: Murderous Spoils
cards.text: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated. You gain control of all Equipment that was attached to it. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

cards.flavor: It is one of the oldest nim, steeped so long in the Dross that it has lost all vestiges of humanity.
cards.name: Nim Abomination
cards.text: At the beginning of your end step, if Nim Abomination is untapped, you lose 3 life.

cards.flavor: Before tyrants or torturers, there was evil.
cards.name: Pulse of the Dross
cards.text: Target player reveals three cards from his or her hand and you choose one of them. That player discards that card. Then if that player has more cards in hand than you, return Pulse of the Dross to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: The beetles feed not on the flesh of corpses but on the metal, grinding out the iron and steel to add to their own bulky shells.
cards.name: Scavenging Scarab
cards.text: Scavenging Scarab can't block.

cards.flavor: There's no escaping an enemy that lives inside your head.
cards.name: Screams from Within
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -1/-1.
When enchanted creature dies, return Screams from Within from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.flavor: When leonin settlers abandon their homes to the nim, items of value are often left behind.
cards.name: Scrounge
cards.text: Target opponent chooses an artifact card in his or her graveyard. Put that card onto the battlefield under your control.

cards.name: Shriveling Rot
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Until end of turn, whenever a creature is dealt damage, destroy it.
• Until end of turn, whenever a creature dies, that creature's controller loses life equal to its toughness.
Entwine {2}{B} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

cards.flavor: Every creature on Mirrodin is a lightning rod.
cards.name: Barbed Lightning
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Barbed Lightning deals 3 damage to target creature.
• Barbed Lightning deals 3 damage to target player.
Entwine {2} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

cards.flavor: Because fighting is easier than figuring out what else to do.
cards.name: Crazed Goblin
cards.text: Crazed Goblin attacks each turn if able.

cards.flavor:
"If only the living were so easily salvaged."
—Memnarch
cards.name: Dismantle
cards.text: Destroy target artifact. If that artifact had counters on it, put that many +1/+1 counters or charge counters on an artifact you control.

cards.flavor:
"Is it the stomping kind or the munching kind?"
—Slobad, goblin tinkerer
cards.name: Drooling Ogre
cards.text: Whenever a player casts an artifact spell, that player gains control of Drooling Ogre. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

cards.flavor: A single misstep unleashes an avalanche of ruin.
cards.name: Echoing Ruin
cards.text: Destroy target artifact and all other artifacts with the same name as that artifact.

cards.flavor: The spell fell upon the crowd like a dragon, ancient and full of death.
cards.name: Fireball
cards.text:
Fireball deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among any number of target creatures and/or players.
Fireball costs {1} more to cast for each target beyond the first.

cards.flavor:
"Now I'm thirsty."
—Korva, Vulshok battlemaster
cards.name: Flamebreak
cards.text: Flamebreak deals 3 damage to each creature without flying and each player. Creatures dealt damage this way can't be regenerated this turn.

cards.name: Furnace Dragon
cards.text:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
Flying
When Furnace Dragon enters the battlefield, if you cast it from your hand, exile all artifacts.

cards.flavor: Always easily impressed, Durg was about to be blown away.
cards.name: Goblin Archaeologist
cards.text: {R}, {T}: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, destroy target artifact and untap Goblin Archaeologist. If you lose the flip, sacrifice Goblin Archaeologist.

cards.flavor: A Vulshok weapon strikes with the fire of the forge that made it.
cards.name: Inflame
cards.text: Inflame deals 2 damage to each creature dealt damage this turn.

cards.flavor: Fallen enemies are fed to the scavengers. Fallen friends are thrown into the Great Furnace, their souls returned to the Great Mother.
cards.name: Krark-Clan Stoker
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice an artifact: Add {R}{R} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: Before wars or weapons, there was anger.
cards.name: Pulse of the Forge
cards.text: Pulse of the Forge deals 4 damage to target player. Then if that player has more life than you, return Pulse of the Forge to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Savage Beating
cards.text:
Cast Savage Beating only during your turn and only during combat.
Choose one —
• Creatures you control gain double strike until end of turn.
• Untap all creatures you control. After this phase, there is an additional combat phase.
Entwine {1}{R} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

cards.flavor: "You might want to work on your aim."
cards.name: Shunt
cards.text: Change the target of target spell with a single target.

cards.flavor:
"I used to joke that he had been exiled for being too smart. Now I know why he never laughed."
—Glissa Sunseeker
cards.name: Slobad, Goblin Tinkerer
cards.text: Sacrifice an artifact: Target artifact gains indestructible until end of turn. (Effects that say "destroy" don't destroy it. A creature with indestructible can't be destroyed by damage.)

cards.name: Tears of Rage
cards.text:
Cast Tears of Rage only during the declare attackers step.
Attacking creatures you control get +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the number of attacking creatures. Sacrifice those creatures at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.flavor: Compared to the fire of the forge, the strength of steel is nothing.
cards.name: Unforge
cards.text: Destroy target Equipment. If that Equipment was attached to a creature, Unforge deals 2 damage to that creature.

cards.flavor: It must eat its weight in metal daily, or its furnacelike belly will consume itself for lack of fuel.
cards.name: Vulshok War Boar
cards.text: When Vulshok War Boar enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice an artifact.

cards.flavor: Tel-Jilad's sworn protectors are the trolls, yet more fearsome protectors were created by the Tangle itself.
cards.name: Ageless Entity
cards.text: Whenever you gain life, put that many +1/+1 counters on Ageless Entity.

cards.flavor: A single seed unleashes a flurry of growth.
cards.name: Echoing Courage
cards.text: Target creature and all other creatures with the same name as that creature get +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: In the Tangle, bad is often followed by worse.
cards.name: Fangren Firstborn
cards.text: Whenever Fangren Firstborn attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on each attacking creature.

cards.name: Infested Roothold
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Protection from artifacts
Whenever an opponent casts an artifact spell, you may put a 1/1 green Insect creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Karstoderm
cards.text:
Karstoderm enters the battlefield with five +1/+1 counters on it.
Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield, remove a +1/+1 counter from Karstoderm.

cards.flavor: Gelfruit grows abundantly wherever Sylvok druids live, as if the Tangle knows that humans are not as hardy as the beasts or as nimble as the elves.
cards.name: Nourish
cards.text: You gain 6 life.

cards.flavor:
"Ashes to ashes, rust to rust."
—Viridian shaman
cards.name: Oxidize
cards.text: Destroy target artifact. It can't be regenerated.

cards.flavor: Before predators or prey, there was life.
cards.name: Pulse of the Tangle
cards.text: Put a 3/3 green Beast creature token onto the battlefield. Then if an opponent controls more creatures than you, return Pulse of the Tangle to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Reap and Sow
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target land.
• Search your library for a land card, put that card onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.
Entwine {1}{G} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

cards.flavor: From the Radix at the hub of the Tangle all the way out to the Edges of Forgetting, a Viridian elf's life is built around the temporary.
cards.name: Rebuking Ceremony
cards.text: Put two target artifacts on top of their owners' libraries.

cards.flavor: Wurms compete for nesting grounds near the Radix. The young who hatch closest have the best chance for survival.
cards.name: Roaring Slagwurm
cards.text: Whenever Roaring Slagwurm attacks, tap all artifacts.

cards.flavor: Strange times make for strange allies.
cards.name: Stand Together
cards.text: Put two +1/+1 counters on target creature and two +1/+1 counters on another target creature.

cards.flavor: They're considered good luck by the elves they don't eat.
cards.name: Tangle Spider
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

cards.flavor: In bringing life to Mirrodin, Memnarch was more successful than he knew—for Mirrodin began to take on a life of its own.
cards.name: Tanglewalker
cards.text: Each creature you control can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an artifact land.

cards.flavor: "When the levelers come again, we shall be ready for them."
cards.name: Tel-Jilad Outrider
cards.text: Protection from artifacts

cards.flavor: Thanks to the wolves, Tel-Jilad is the one area of Mirrodin the myr don't see often.
cards.name: Tel-Jilad Wolf
cards.text: Whenever Tel-Jilad Wolf becomes blocked by an artifact creature, Tel-Jilad Wolf gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "We have no sun to guide our dead, so I tend the prismatic flames of the spirit fires that show the souls their way. When I die, I hope there is one left to guide my spirit home."
cards.name: Viridian Acolyte
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: "I will fight only the way nature intended—and nature intended us to win."
cards.name: Viridian Zealot
cards.text: {1}{G}, Sacrifice Viridian Zealot: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.name: Æther Vial
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a charge counter on Æther Vial.
{T}: You may put a creature card with converted mana cost equal to the number of charge counters on Æther Vial from your hand onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: If taken, it cuts the hand that clutches it. If given, it heals the hand that holds it.
cards.name: Angel's Feather
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a white spell, you may gain 1 life.

cards.flavor: It breaches not physical distances but temporal ones.
cards.name: Arcane Spyglass
cards.text:
{2}, {T}, Sacrifice a land: Draw a card and put a charge counter on Arcane Spyglass.
Remove three charge counters from Arcane Spyglass: Draw a card.

cards.flavor: Break in case of emergency.
cards.name: Arcbound Bruiser
cards.text: Modular 3 (This enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it. When it dies, you may put its +1/+1 counters on target artifact creature.)

cards.name: Arcbound Crusher
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever another artifact enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on Arcbound Crusher.
Modular 1 (This enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. When it dies, you may put its +1/+1 counters on target artifact creature.)

cards.name: Arcbound Fiend
cards.text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may move a +1/+1 counter from target creature onto Arcbound Fiend.
Modular 3 (This enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it. When it dies, you may put its +1/+1 counters on target artifact creature.)

cards.name: Arcbound Hybrid
cards.text:
Haste
Modular 2 (This enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it. When it dies, you may put its +1/+1 counters on target artifact creature.)

cards.name: Arcbound Lancer
cards.text:
First strike
Modular 4 (This enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it. When it dies, you may put its +1/+1 counters on target artifact creature.)

cards.name: Arcbound Overseer
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on each creature with modular you control.
Modular 6 (This enters the battlefield with six +1/+1 counters on it. When it dies, you may put its +1/+1 counters on target artifact creature.)

cards.name: Arcbound Ravager
cards.text:
Sacrifice an artifact: Put a +1/+1 counter on Arcbound Ravager.
Modular 1 (This enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. When it dies, you may put its +1/+1 counters on target artifact creature.)

cards.name: Arcbound Reclaimer
cards.text:
Remove a +1/+1 counter from Arcbound Reclaimer: Put target artifact card from your graveyard on top of your library.
Modular 2 (This enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it. When it dies, you may put its +1/+1 counters on target artifact creature.)

cards.name: Arcbound Slith
cards.text:
Whenever Arcbound Slith deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
Modular 1 (This enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. When it dies, you may put its +1/+1 counters on target artifact creature.)

cards.name: Arcbound Stinger
cards.text:
Flying
Modular 1 (This enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. When it dies, you may put its +1/+1 counters on target artifact creature.)

cards.flavor: The parts are as strong as the whole.
cards.name: Arcbound Worker
cards.text: Modular 1 (This enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. When it dies, you may put its +1/+1 counters on target artifact creature.)

cards.flavor: Everything in its path is either pushed aside or ground under.
cards.name: Auriok Siege Sled
cards.text:
{1}: Target artifact creature blocks Auriok Siege Sled this turn if able.
{1}: Target artifact creature can't block Auriok Siege Sled this turn.

cards.name: Chimeric Egg
cards.text:
Whenever an opponent casts a nonartifact spell, put a charge counter on Chimeric Egg.
Remove three charge counters from Chimeric Egg: Chimeric Egg becomes a 6/6 Construct artifact creature with trample until end of turn.

cards.flavor: It converts the faintest surges of power from Mirrodin's core into usable energy, providing endless power for Memnarch's creations on the surface.
cards.name: Coretapper
cards.text:
{T}: Put a charge counter on target artifact.
Sacrifice Coretapper: Put two charge counters on target artifact.

cards.name: Darksteel Brute
cards.text:
Indestructible (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy this artifact.)
{3}: Darksteel Brute becomes a 2/2 Beast artifact creature until end of turn.

cards.name: Darksteel Colossus
cards.text:
Trample, indestructible
If Darksteel Colossus would be put into a graveyard from anywhere, reveal Darksteel Colossus and shuffle it into its owner's library instead.

cards.flavor:
"Did it have this shape upon Mirrodin's creation, or did some inconceivable force shape the unshapable?"
—Pontifex, elder researcher
cards.name: Darksteel Forge
cards.text: Artifacts you control have indestructible. (Effects that say "destroy" don't destroy them. Artifact creatures with indestructible can't be destroyed by damage.)

cards.flavor: The ultimate treasure is one that guards itself.
cards.name: Darksteel Gargoyle
cards.text:
Flying
Indestructible (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy this creature.)

cards.name: Darksteel Ingot
cards.text:
Indestructible
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Darksteel Pendant
cards.text:
Indestructible (Effects that say "destroy" don't destroy this artifact.)
{1}, {T}: Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

cards.name: Darksteel Reactor
cards.text:
Indestructible (Effects that say "destroy" don't destroy this artifact.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a charge counter on Darksteel Reactor.
When Darksteel Reactor has twenty or more charge counters on it, you win the game.

cards.name: Death-Mask Duplicant
cards.text:
Imprint — {1}: Exile target creature card from your graveyard.
As long as a card exiled with Death-Mask Duplicant has flying, Death-Mask Duplicant has flying. The same is true for fear, first strike, double strike, haste, landwalk, protection, and trample.

cards.flavor: Its curve mimics the twists of life and death.
cards.name: Demon's Horn
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a black spell, you may gain 1 life.

cards.flavor: Though no longer attached to the hand, it still holds its adversary in its grasp.
cards.name: Dragon's Claw
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a red spell, you may gain 1 life.

cards.flavor: In close proximity, their magnetic energies merge and form a field of protection.
cards.name: Drill-Skimmer
cards.text:
Flying
Drill-Skimmer has shroud as long as you control another artifact creature. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

cards.flavor: The longer it skulks through the corrosive gases of Mephidross, the more it adopts their thirst for death.
cards.name: Dross Golem
cards.text:
Affinity for Swamps (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each Swamp you control.)
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

cards.flavor: When Mirrodin's varied civilizations developed ways to fight the levelers, Memnarch upped the stakes.
cards.name: Eater of Days
cards.text:
Flying, trample
When Eater of Days enters the battlefield, you skip your next two turns.

cards.name: Gemini Engine
cards.text: Whenever Gemini Engine attacks, put a colorless Construct artifact creature token named Twin onto the battlefield attacking. Its power is equal to Gemini Engine's power and its toughness is equal to Gemini Engine's toughness. Sacrifice the token at end of combat.

cards.flavor:
"As the experimental population grows, so do the number of myr. It's a perfect equilibrium."
—Memnarch
cards.name: Genesis Chamber
cards.text: Whenever a nontoken creature enters the battlefield, if Genesis Chamber is untapped, that creature's controller puts a 1/1 colorless Myr artifact creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: The book shrieks horribly until its cover is opened, granting the spirit inside a moment's rest from the painful stirrings of the book's contents.
cards.name: Geth's Grimoire
cards.text: Whenever an opponent discards a card, you may draw a card.

You don't lose the game for having 0 or less life.
Whenever you lose life, sacrifice a permanent for each 1 life you lost. (Damage causes loss of life.)

cards.flavor: In the blur between metal and flesh, Memnarch found madness.
cards.name: Memnarch
cards.text:
{1}{U}{U}: Target permanent becomes an artifact in addition to its other types. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
{3}{U}: Gain control of target artifact. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

cards.name: Mycosynth Lattice
cards.text:
All permanents are artifacts in addition to their other types.
All cards that aren't on the battlefield, spells, and permanents are colorless.
Players may spend mana as though it were mana of any color.

cards.flavor: One thing the myr can't do is enjoy the scenery.
